error_notWpCom: The URL is not wordpress.com, please check again.
error_noProfile: No profile, please add one at least
error_profileNotMatch: WordPress profile not match. Which one do you want to use?
command_publishWithDefault: Publish current note with default options
settings_urlDesc: Full path of installed WordPress, for example, https://example.com/wordpress
settings_apiTypeDesc: Select which API you want to use.
settings_apiTypeXmlRpcDesc: XML-RPC was enabled by default but some sites may disable it because of security problems.
settings_apiTypeRestMiniOrangeDesc: REST API was enabled by default in WordPress 4.7+. These APIs should be authenticated by extra plugin miniOrange which should be installed and enabled in WordPress server.
settings_apiTypeRestApplicationPasswords: REST API Authentication by application passwords
REST API was enabled by default in WordPress 4.7+ while application passwords was introduced in WordPress 5.6+.
settings_showRibbonIconDesc: If enabled, a button which opens publish panel will be added to the Obsidian sidebar.
settings_defaultPostStatusDesc: Post status which will be published to WordPress.
settings_rememberLastSelectedCategoriesD: Remember last selected post categories of this site.
settings_showWordPressEditPageModalDesc: Show open WordPress edit page confirmation when publish successfully
settings_wpComOAuth2RefreshTokenDesc: Click right button to validate or refresh wordpress.com OAuth2 token.
settings_defaultPostCommentDesc: Comment status which will be published to WordPress.
settings_MathJaxOutputTypeTeXDesc: Convert MathJax to TeX directly. WordPress needs install MathJax related plugin, such as simple-mathjax.
settings_MathJaxOutputTypeSVGDesc: Convert MathJax to SVG. Browser render SVG, no plugin needed for WordPress.
settings_commentConvertModeDesc: Select how to convert Obsidian notes comments.
settings_commentConvertModeIgnoreDesc: Just ignore all comments and convert comments to empty.
settings_commentConvertModeHTMLDesc: Convert Obsidian notes comments to HTML comments.
settings_enableHtmlDesc: Enable HTML tags in notes. This might cause XSS attack to your WordPress.
settings_publishAsBlocksDesc: Converts the HTML code to a valid block editor format (Gutenberg)
settings_replaceMediaLinksDesc: Replace media links to WordPress URLs after uploading.
loginModal_rememberUsernameDesc: If enabled, the WordPress username you typed will be saved in local data. This might be disclosure in synchronize services.
loginModal_rememberPasswordDesc: If enabled, the WordPress password you typed will be saved in local data. This might be disclosure in synchronize services.
publishModal_postDateTimeDesc: With format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
publishModal_wrongMatterDataForPage: There are tags or categories in matter-data which are not allowed for page. Are you sure to delete these data?
publishedModal_confirmEditInWP: Do you want to open WordPress edit page in browser?
profilesChooserModal_pickOne: Click to pick one profile to publish.
profileNotMatch_useNew: Create a new post using "<%= profileName %>"
